Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
the main issue with iguana is TIME_WAIT on local host.... but if u put them in VMs or docker, then it doesnt matter at all
the limit per VM would be MAX 128 coins.. and 64 would be much safer, 32 even better. some ppl already had issues starting coin daemons, with RPC port bound to something else. 
for scale test I managed 1024 coins, but had to firewall OS start coins, then iguana.
drop firewall. 
without that things would just fail to start, not being able to bind a port.

Author: cipi#4502
Content: `the main issue with iguana is TIME_WAIT on local host` ... yes, and it is only connections from iguana to the coins RPC port... wonder if iguana could manage this better, to reduce the number of TIME_WAIT connections... normally it is not a big problem, even with 10s of thousands of such connections, but the higher the number, the bigger the chance that you will have trouble starting up the wallets, because the rpcport they try to listen to is already in use by such a TIME_WAIT connection... but if you manage to start your wallets, it doesn't matter any more

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: start all the wallets first

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
the other solution to this problem would be to use rpcports only outside of this range: `net.ipv4.ip_local_port_range = 16001 65530`
normally this setting is 32000 to 65000... i increased it a bit on my node
or start the wallets first 😃

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
or use more then one local ip... like 127.0.0.2 ... 127.0.0.3 and you have more ports ;-)
but that would need some changes

Author: cipi#4502
Content: i suppose 127.0.0.1 is hardcoded somewhere as the IP to the wallets RPC interface... if you changes that to 127.0.0.2 and let the wallets listen to 127.0.0.2, the problem with the wallet startup would be gone
